intro: Epilobium davuricum, commonly known as the Siberian willow or Davurian willow, is a flowering plant native to the cold climates of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and in tundra regions. The plant features slender, often reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its showy, pink to purple flowers bloom in clusters during the summer months. Epilobium davuricum is adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
